div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2019 Catanzaro environs, Bruttium, 1967 Burial: late 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: c. 36 AR Neapolis: 1 st. (obv. elephant symbol, rev. BI) Taras: 1 st. (Per. VIII Λ ϒΚΙΝΟΣ) Campano-Tarentine: 2 st. (dolphin; dolphin and trident symbols) Heracleia: 1 st. (as SNGOxford 641) Brettii: 25 st. (Nike/river-god as Scheu, NC 1962, nos. 6 [2], 12?, 13, 15, 17, 21 [2], 26 [2], 29 [2], 45, 52, 53 [2], 54 [2], 56, 57 [2], 58 [2]; and obv. bucranium, rev. round shield [2] 4 st. (Hera/Zeus as Scheu, nos. 68, 70, 78, 84) Carthage: 1 half-shekel (as NC 1964, pl. 5, 14) Roman Rep.: 1 st. (Apollo hd./horse) Disposition: dispersed Seen in commerce
